snippet: Relatives, but not the public, will be able to visit the repository, which is in the same building as the National September 11 Memorial Museum.
abstract: New York City notifies families of September 11 victims that unidentified remains of those killed at the World Trade Center will be moved to specially built repository in National September 11 Memorial Museum; news is met with mixture of anger, confusion and acceptance, reflecting divisions of opinion, and continued heightened passions, of family members.
lead_paragraph: Relatives, but not the public, will be able to visit the repository, which is in the same building as the National September 11 Memorial Museum.

headline.main: New York City Gives Families of 9/11 Victims One-Week Notice That Remains Will Be Moved
headline.print_headline: Remains of 9/11 Victims Will Be Moved
